column5: Was fortunate enough to get up to the Sioux Lookout area for ice fishing last week. Have been wanting to do this for almost 20 years. Finally! Loved it so much we are going back in March. We stayed at Moosehorn Lodge at the main cabin. Wow it was so nice! I know these waters really well, but decided to use a guide. Thank you so much to Colin and Brian as they were awesome guides and people. They put us on some nice fish and see you 2 in March.
Just curious - How thick was the ice and which lake(s) did you hit ? Lac Seul?

We mostly fished Minnitaki Lake, we did fish Big Vermillion and another lake I am not sure of the name. Ice was 18-20 Inches. Was surprised that there was not more ice than that. Could be an early ice out!Mike
Colin is a great guide, my daughter caught her first walleye last summer while colin was guiding our family on minnitaki.
Sorry, better picture of her fish.

Thanks for the great comments guys. It was a pleasure fishing with you, and looking forward to doing it again! Weather is getting warmer, but that will mean more slush. We just had a good dump of snow. Looking forward to March and the entire open water season! I am all about my guests catching lots of fish, and thoroughly enjoy every trip that I take.
IowaWalleyeGuy, Wow that is a nice fish she caught! And I do agree with you for sure.Mike
Awesome to see the pics from your trip. Colin told me all about it. Great walleye, white fish and trout fishing guys!! Hope you'll be back. The winter is just as fun as the summer up here!!
